pageContent.title: Measuring Results
pageContent.descriptionText: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:16pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px; padding:0 0 0 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Measuring Results</Introtext><welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">When you arrive at the Maycomb cardiology department to meet with Dr. Gomez, you catch up and then start the meeting by confirming the priorities for the department: Achieving Patient Treatment Goals and Maintaining/Improving their Professional Reputation. Dr. Gomez agrees that these are the department’s top two concerns. Regarding the patient treatment goals, she emphasizes all the aspects of the patient treatment goals – clinical results, patient satisfaction, and quality metrics. “Just consider the patient I have now,” she said. “Even if I get her sodium levels under control, that doesn’t mean she’ll be happy with the methods I used.”</welcomeText>
